cards.title: Picture of the day / Space Age speeding to victory at Royal Ascot
cards.rawTitle: Space Age speeding to victory at Royal Ascot

item.title: Sport picture of the day: Space Age speeding to victory at Royal Ascot
item.trailText: A steady hand was needed by the photographer when producing this panning shot that illustrates the speed that William Buick was travelling on Space Age as they charged to victory in the King George V Stakes on Ladies’ Day at Royal Ascot
item.standFirst: A steady hand was needed by the photographer when producing this panning shot that illustrates the speed that William Buick was travelling on Space Age as they charged to victory in the King George V Stakes on Ladies’ Day at Royal Ascot

displayImages.altText: Space Age ridden by the jockey William Buick (right) on the way to winning the King George V Stakes during Ladies' Day, on day three of Royal Ascot

cards.title: Picture of the day / The long and winding road

item.title: Sport picture of the day: the long and winding road
item.trailText: The peloton and their support vehicles ascend the Bielerhöhe as they travel from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria on stage five of the 2015 Tour de Suisse.
item.standFirst: The peloton and their support vehicles ascend the Bielerhöhe as they travel from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria on stage five of the 2015 Tour de Suisse. The 237.3 km stage was the longest that the race has featured in the last 20 years. The stage was won by Thibaut Pinot in a time of 6h 22’ 47”, which means the yellow jersery holder is now 47” ahead of Team Sky’s Geraint Thomas in the general classification

displayImages.altText: The peloton rides during the 5th stage, a 237,3 km race, from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria, during the 79th Tour de Suisse UCI ProTour cycling race.

headerImage.caption: The peloton rides during the fifth stage, 237.3 km long, from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria, on the 79th Tour de Suisse, in Bielerhöhe, Austria. Photograph: Jean-Christophe Bott/EPA
headerImage.altText: The peloton rides during the fifth stage, 237.3 km long, from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria, on the 79th Tour de Suisse, in Bielerhoehe, Austria.
headerImage.cleanCaption: The peloton rides during the fifth stage, 237.3 km long, from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria, on the 79th Tour de Suisse, in Bielerhöhe, Austria.

image.altText: The peloton rides during the 5th stage, a 237,3 km race, from Unterterzen in Switzerland to Sölden in Austria, during the 79th Tour de Suisse UCI ProTour cycling race.
